{{About|the Australian singer-songwriter|the English footballer|Steve Forde (footballer)}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2020}} {{Use Australian English|date=August 2011}} '''Steve Forde''' is an Australian [[country music]] artist{{cite web |url=http://www.entertainmentedge.com.au/roster/forde/forde.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090304183143/http://www.entertainmentedge.com.au/roster/forde/forde.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=4 March 2009 |title=Biography of Steve Forde & The Flange |access-date=2008-08-17 |last=Potts |first=Rob |publisher=Entertainment Edge}} and host of ''Rollin with...'' on the [[Country Music Channel]].{{citation needed|date=November 2020}} ==Biography== ===Early years=== Steve Forde was born in the regional farming centre of [[Cowra, New South Wales]] in 1977. Steve spent most of his early childhood moving from town to town across NSW with his family. He is a singer, a songwriter and a touring country star. Although retired now, Steve was a successful bull rider and bareback bronc rider.{{citation needed|date=November 2020}} At 18 years old, Ford joined his first band and tasted the life of a touring country musician. It was also during this time that Forde decided that he wanted to join the rodeo as a bull rider.{{citation needed|date=November 2020}} When he left for the United States in 1998 he joined a country band in [[Texas]] and toured through [[Colorado]], [[South Dakota]] and into Canada. When the gigs were lean he would work in bars, building fences or riding bareback broncos in [[Lubbock, Texas]].{{citation needed|date=November 2020}} Steve returned to Australia when his father needed help on the farm; he continued with the rodeos during weekends. He bought his farm, near [[Grenfell, New South Wales]] and set about getting it cleaned up, stocked up and productive while still helping at his father's farm; and finding time to continue riding broncos.{{citation needed|date=November 2020}} ===2000-present: Recording years=== In 2000, Steve started his band ''The Flange'' whose debut album ''[[Livin' Right (album)|Livin' Right]]'' was released in May 2002. At the 2003 Country Music Awards of Australia, the band were nominated in two categories. The single "What I’m talking about" spent twenty-six weeks in the CMC top twenty.{{citation needed|date=November 2020}} The band's second album, ''Wild Ride'' was recorded in Nashville in December 2003 and released in 2004.{{citation needed|date=November 2020}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" border="1" |+ List of albums, with Australian chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:20em;" | Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:16em;" | Album details ! scope="col" colspan="1" | Peak chart
